product_name: Samsung Galaxy Buds FE True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Comfort and Secure in Ear Fit, Auto Switch Audio, Touch Control, Built-in Voice Assistant, Graphite [US Version, 1Yr Manufacturer Warranty]

reviews.review: I don’t usually write reviews, but I felt compelled to share how impressed I am with these headphones! I have small ears, and most earbuds never stay in place. The only ones that worked for me in the past were the Bose SoundSport. After that, I used Beats Pro over-ear headphones. While they stayed on, I was never truly impressed with the sound quality.I spent weeks researching before purchasing these, and I’m so glad I did. They fit comfortably in my small ears and stay put without any issues. The active noise cancellation is excellent—at the gym, I used to hear conversations and background noise through my old headphones, but with these properly seated, I hear NOTHING at all!The sound quality and clarity are a noticeable upgrade from my old Beats, and I really like being able to adjust the sound through the app. I prefer bass-heavy music, and these deliver. While volume controls on the earbuds themselves would be nice, it’s not a deal breaker since my phone is usually nearby.If you struggle with earbuds staying in your ears and want a high-quality pair of headphones that cost about half the price of other major brands—while performing even better in my opinion—I highly recommend giving these a try!

These are great sounding earbuds and they are fantastic for the price. You really can't get any better. I specifically needed these though because I need a good transparency mode and I didn't want to spend too much for earbuds. I have nicer earbuds that have much better noise canceling but The trade-off with the other earbuds that I have tried was that they had a poor transparency mode so it seems like at this price you kind of get one of the other. The noise canceling isn't terrible on these earbuds it's just that if that is what you want more than anything you can get better on different earbuds. So again if you're looking for a good all-around earbud with great transparency mode go with these. I should also note I have smaller ears and although they are a little bit bulky they fit and they do not fall out. A little tip though, twist them a little bit to get them to grab onto your ear just right.
Great earbuds.  I like how you can costomize them to fit your ear.  Great sound. And easy to control.  They connected to my Samsung phone with no issues and work great.

These Galaxy buds fe are almost perfect.As an audiophile these definitely sound great, a bit of treble sparkle, slightly boosted mids and BASS. While I personally think they sound better than the Method 360 ANC by Skullcandy, they have quite a ways to go to become the perfect earbud.The battery life is not the greatest as I only get 5-6 hours with ANC on. And about 22-24 with the case.The fit is very good, I'm glad to see a stability fin on these. Not only does it make them fit better, but man do the look good. Also speaking of the fin, they do stay in the ear very well, and with their IPX2 rating I've had them drenched in sweat and snow and everything still works so prompts to Samsung.The ANC is good enough as it reduces background noise and softens conversations around.The app experience is very cool, one thing is I downloaded the Wearable app and was told that the app was not needed and that I could access everything from the settings app on my S23. Don't know if it was a UI update or something, but all very cool.Two things. One, the ANC stays off until you go into the settings and change it yourself, so you can have ANC in just one  earbud.Two, the wear detection works but it takes the earbuds a second to realize its not in my ear. Also just a general note I'd like to have a company who makes an earbud with wear detection and it just pauses the earbud you took out and not both earbuds.Overall they are very good earbuds and will be great for a casual listener who wants a Samsung product. These are great!!!

Recently purchased these because a older set of wireless earbuds I had started to glitch out in the left ear wouldn't charge properly. So bit  bullet and bought these and I'm glad I did. They were easy to connect. They charge great. They fit in the ear perfectly and come with sized earbuds and a few other attachments from outside the ear when the earbuds are in  to adjust for comfort. wasn't too deep in Pocket (if you choose to do a monthly payment plan like I did) comes in into simple yet pretty good looking colors. I must say black and white. I chose white so I can find them even in their case in the case itself fits in the palm of the hand very comfortably and I omit I am bad with taking the earbuds out of the case and sometimes holding the case itself, but in having had these for a bit. I did fumble the case and it didn't fly open which is a blessing The functions in the earbuds themselves are very simple, personally I have absolutely no care that they don't do volume control for me. It's starting stopping and just moving on to the next song and answering calls. They are very excellent for that. They work great. Oh, and let's not forget the sound quality and noise cancellation. It doesn't drown out the environment around you, but it gives a perfect balance of quiet and self-awareness where you can enjoy what you're listening to and not be completely unaware of what's going on around you.

product_name: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Redesigned Comfort Fit, Silver [US Version, Amazon Exclusive, 2Yr Warranty]

reviews.review: The Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro is the epitome of an amazing truly wireless earphone journey that users can ask for discerning sound quality, connection, and features.Upon unpacking these slim, shiny earphones that are the color of silver you will definitely notice the amount of effort Samsung has put into designing them. The redesign of the comfort fit means that these buds will stay intact even during the most rigorous workouts or prolonged listening to of music. The design of the headphones follows the contours of the head enhancing on noise cancellation thus providing the user with toch sound without interruption.When it comes to sound, and you will be hard pressed to find a better set of true wireless earphones than the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro. The 3D audio technology involved with the earbuds puts you in an immersive and spacious sound field when you listen to music, movies or podcasts. The sound optimization which is done through AI enhances the sound to meet your specific preference as a user. The end product is clear and dynamic sound that is at par with wired headphones’ experience.This is complemented by the noise cancellation function integrated into these earphones. Just like all Samsung’s gadgets the noise cancelling feature is very much advanced and there was no interference of outside noise when I listened to my audio content. Even when all you need is to listen to your music/library, or if you have a work/business to attend to, you can exercise the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro noise cancellation feature.But more is still on store, in the lines of innovation. The real-time built-in interpreter will ensure that you don’t leave a meeting or during your foreign trip stranded for words during the meeting. It employs an AI algorithm that allows you to translate up to 16 languages from the location of your travel to avoid communication barriers.The other fact that differentiates the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro from another is the battery power of this accessory. To provide a small overall volume, these compact earbuds are equipped with efficient design and mighty battery that allows recording 29 hours of playback time. This means you can listen to any type of audio content for days without having to plug your earphones to a charger.With regards to connectivity, it’s got simple pairing and smart switching between devices in line with Bluetooth 5.3. If you have any other Samsung device, the company’s well-integrated experience guarantees that your Galaxy Buds 3 Pro will always be waiting for connection.Finally, a 2-year warranty exclusively available on Amazon also means that your beautific investment will serve shelter for potential flaws in the device.If you want to buy truly wireless earbuds, the Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro has that feature down pat, robust sound quality, additional bells and whistles, and ergonomic design of the earbuds. If you intend to find lose a pair of wireless earbuds that may serve your active lifestyle whilst providing the best sound quality, Galaxy Buds 3 Pro should definitely fit the bill. You won't be disappointed.

Actually worth the price. The pinch function works great, the ANC is great, the volume is spectacular, and they fit in my ear for my 6 mile run today and didn't fall out even remotely (despite that i sweat a lot). The case is compact and everything is very well built, although the case feels a bit "plastic-y". Just be cautious with that. They are pretty comfortable as well, the M size nibs fit for me. The connectivity is of course very quick and took me less than a minute to set it up right. No fooling around with EQs necessarry either- for most. They sound fantastic out the box. If you're a bit of an audiophile like me, you'll appreciate the experience for all genres. I suspect if you like a lot of hip hop/rap/pop/electronic music you may want to hike up the bass and scoop the mids a bit. And for rock/metal/country/jazz/classical these will sound great as is but i lowered the 4k a bit and boosted the 63 and 125 to give it a slight bump in bass still for personal preference. Highly recommend overall, especially if you have a Samsung as it fits well into the ecosystem. No comment on battery life as this is just 1 good day of use,  but I'm assuming it will work for my purposes and just need to charge up daily/every other day (if that? Maybe better?) which is okay either way.

I’ve used almost every iteration of the Galaxy Buds, and the Buds 3 Pro are a massive step up in terms of hardware. The soundstage is wider and the call clarity is the best I’ve experienced on a pair of stems.The Pros:The Fit: They feel more secure than the previous 'bean' or 'bud' shapes. I can wear them for hours without ear fatigue.ANC Performance: The Active Noise Canceling is top-tier. It easily drowns out low-frequency hums like plane engines or office chatter.Sound Quality: Crisp highs and a punchy bass that doesn't feel muddy.The One Con: If you like to sing along to your music, turn off the Voice Detect/Adaptive mode. The AI is so sensitive that it thinks I’m trying to start a conversation whenever I sing a lyric, and it immediately lowers the music volume. It’s a great feature for an office, but a total buzzkill for solo jam sessions.Verdict: Incredible hardware. Just be prepared to dive into the Wearable app settings to customize the AI features to your liking.

The real-time built-in interpreter will ensure that you don’t leave a meeting or during your foreign trip stranded for words during the meeting. It employs an AI algorithm that allows you to translate up to 16 languages from the location of your travel to avoid communication barriers.The other fact that differentiates the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro from another is the battery power of this accessory. To provide a small overall volume, these compact earbuds are equipped with efficient design and mighty battery that allows recording 29 hours of playback time. This means you can listen to any type of audio content for days without having to plug your earphones to a charger.With regards to connectivity, it’s got simple pairing and smart switching between devices in line with Bluetooth 5.3. If you have any other Samsung device, the company’s well-integrated experience guarantees that your Galaxy Buds 3 Pro will always be waiting for connection.Finally, a 2-year warranty exclusively available on Amazon also means that your beautific investment will serve shelter for potential flaws in the device.If you want to buy truly wireless earbuds, the Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro has that feature down pat, robust sound quality, additional bells and whistles, and ergonomic design of the earbuds. If you intend to find lose a pair of wireless earbuds that may serve your active lifestyle whilst providing the best sound quality, Galaxy Buds 3 Pro should definitely fit the bill. You won't be disappointed.

Actually worth the price. The pinch function works great, the ANC is great, the volume is spectacular, and they fit in my ear for my 6 mile run today and didn't fall out even remotely (despite that i sweat a lot). The case is compact and everything is very well built, although the case feels a bit "plastic-y". Just be cautious with that. They are pretty comfortable as well, the M size nibs fit for me. The connectivity is of course very quick and took me less than a minute to set it up right. No fooling around with EQs necessarry either- for most. They sound fantastic out the box. If you're a bit of an audiophile like me, you'll appreciate the experience for all genres. I suspect if you like a lot of hip hop/rap/pop/electronic music you may want to hike up the bass and scoop the mids a bit. And for rock/metal/country/jazz/classical these will sound great as is but i lowered the 4k a bit and boosted the 63 and 125 to give it a slight bump in bass still for personal preference. Highly recommend overall, especially if you have a Samsung as it fits well into the ecosystem. No comment on battery life as this is just 1 good day of use,  but I'm assuming it will work for my purposes and just need to charge up daily/every other day (if that? Maybe better?) which is okay either way.

I’ve used almost every iteration of the Galaxy Buds, and the Buds 3 Pro are a massive step up in terms of hardware. The soundstage is wider and the call clarity is the best I’ve experienced on a pair of stems.The Pros:The Fit: They feel more secure than the previous 'bean' or 'bud' shapes. I can wear them for hours without ear fatigue.ANC Performance: The Active Noise Canceling is top-tier. It easily drowns out low-frequency hums like plane engines or office chatter.Sound Quality: Crisp highs and a punchy bass that doesn't feel muddy.The One Con: If you like to sing along to your music, turn off the Voice Detect/Adaptive mode. The AI is so sensitive that it thinks I’m trying to start a conversation whenever I sing a lyric, and it immediately lowers the music volume. It’s a great feature for an office, but a total buzzkill for solo jam sessions.Verdict: Incredible hardware. Just be prepared to dive into the Wearable app settings to customize the AI features to your liking.

product_name: Samsung Galaxy Buds Fan Edition(FE) SM-R400, Active Noise-Cancelling, Wireless Bluetooth v5.2 Earbuds, Android 8.0 and Up - (Graphite)

reviews.review: These work great. The sound quality is great & I love the noise canceling feature. Though you do need the Samsung Wear app to control them - activate / deactivate the noise canceling feature. Since I keep my phone's Bluetooth turned off, I love the feature where after you take the buds out of their case and put them in your ear, you get a message on your phone asking if you want to connect them. I don't have to manually turn on the Bluetooth. The only drawback it seems is that I can't really use them with my Samsung TV. Although they connect and I can hear the sound, after a bit the sound starts to make digital distortions. But, no such issues when connected to the phone. The battery life is great and lasts up to ~6 hours on the buds. The case can charge the buds a few times before it itself requires charging. The Wear app shows the percentage of charge remaining for both the buds as well as the case. And unlike some other types of buds, these are essy to take out of the case.

The Galaxy Buds FE are a great value if you want solid sound and active noise canceling without paying flagship prices. The ANC works surprisingly well for everyday noise like fans, engines, and background chatter. Audio quality is clear with good bass, and call quality has been reliable for me.They’re comfortable enough for long wear and stay in place during daily use. Battery life has been solid, and pairing with Samsung devices is quick and seamless. The app controls are simple and responsive. Overall, these feel well built and dependable for the price.

All I can say is wow. These have to be the best earbuds at this price point by far! Compared to the Airpod Pro's 2 and 3, you are getting by far the best bang for your buck here. Awesome bass and great highs and mids (the mids could be marginally better as opposed to Pro's 2 and 3) but not enough to justify 3x the price of these. Really nice that you can turn off ANC and check both earbud and cae charge level through your phone. My favorite part of these buds is that you don't have to have Bluetooth on to recognize they are near, your phone will automatically ask if you'd like to pair when opening the case, and switches Bluetooth on for you!

The SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Fan Edition (FE) SM-R400 are fantastic! The sound quality is crisp and clear, the fit is comfortable for long listening, and the battery lasts a long time. Easy to connect and use with my phone. A great choice for anyone looking for reliable wireless earbuds! My only negative remark is that it does not support wireless charging.

Love them I have small ears and they fit great on the smallest bud. Would get another pair when I need to replace them.  I like how they fit all the way in and nothing hangs out in the front. I can keep my hair down and no one knows I even have them on especially when at work. Great sound and function.

I bought the SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Fan Edition (FE), and let me just say, these are NOT your average earbuds. These are the superhero of sound, the Beyoncé of Bluetooth, the James Bond of noise-canceling—basically, they’re everything I never knew I needed in my life, and now I can’t live without them.The Pros:Active Noise-Canceling? More Like Active Life-Changing – I thought noise-canceling was just a “cool feature,” but NO. These babies don’t just block out the noise, they block out your ENTIRE LIFE. Kids yelling? Gone. Your neighbor’s dog barking at 3 AM? Not even a whisper. The sound of your own thoughts? Who needs them? These buds don’t let anything in… except for your favorite jams.Earbuds that Fit Like They’re Meant to Be – If you’ve ever bought earbuds that feel like they’re trying to escape your ears mid-jog, then you know the struggle. These? Fit like a glove (except for your ears, obviously, but you get the point). No slipping, no adjusting, no awkwardly trying to pop them back in when you’re about to give a TED Talk on the importance of “Listening to Your Favorite Playlist” (seriously, these fit that snug).Sound Quality That Makes You Feel Like You’re in a Concert Hall – Every note is crisp, every beat is beyond satisfying, and I swear I could hear the microwave beep in a whole new way. These Galaxy Buds make your favorite music sound like it was made in a recording studio with actual magic. If you want to feel like a rockstar while doing your laundry, these are the buds for you.Touch Controls Are So Futuristic, I Feel Like I’m In a Sci-Fi Movie – I didn’t know I needed touch controls until I had them. Want to change the song? Just tap the side. Volume too loud? Swipe down like you're controlling the volume of your future robot overlords. I can practically feel my IQ going up with every tap.Battery Life That Lasts Longer Than My Attention Span – I’ve used these buds for hours and hours, and they still had juice left. It’s like they run on pure, unadulterated energy. I’ve forgotten to charge them overnight and still had a full day of listening ahead of me. The only thing they can’t do is remind me to charge my phone… but that’s probably coming in the next edition.The Cons:I Might Become a Music Snob – I never realized how bad my old earbuds were until I put these in. Now, I’m like, “Oh, this song was supposed to sound like that?” It’s like hearing your favorite song for the first time all over again. Prepare to get snobby about sound quality and turn your nose up at anything less than “active noise-canceling perfection.”Once You Put Them In, You Might Never Leave Your House – Seriously, I put these in while cleaning, and suddenly, I was two hours deep into a podcast and forgot I had even started the dishes. These buds make doing mundane tasks feel like you're in a high-budget music video. Be careful—you might forget how to exist in the real world.Conclusion:The SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Fan Edition (FE) have elevated my audio game in a way I didn’t know was possible. They cancel noise, they amplify sound, and they make me feel like I could conquer the world (or at least my to-do list) while jamming out to my favorite tunes.If you want earbuds that make you feel like a VIP at a private concert, buy these. If you want to block out your neighbor’s questionable karaoke sessions, buy these. And if you just want to listen to your Spotify playlist like it was meant to be heard—you guessed it—buy these.TL;DR: These are the best earbuds I’ve ever had, and I now believe they might be secretly part of a government experiment to make us all smarter, more productive, and significantly cooler. Highly recommend.

I'm a huge researcher when purchasing items online and I'm happy for that with these earbuds. In my opinion, these are a steal because they have the same quality sound, and noise canceling as the $300 ones at a fraction of the price. They stay perfectly in my ears and the battery life is over 6 hours even when listening at higher volumes nonstop. Save some money and go for these. You won't be disappointed

Purchased for my daughter.  She has used them a lot and really likes them.  Good sound quality and fit.  She likes them better than the original Samsung buds she had prior to these.  Build quality is solid.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 FE (2025) True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Active Noise Cancellation, Powerful Sound, Clear Calls, Long Lasting Battery, Hands Free AI, Black [US Version, 2 Year Warranty]

reviews.review: The Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro is the epitome of an amazing truly wireless earphone journey that users can ask for discerning sound quality, connection, and features.Upon unpacking these slim, shiny earphones that are the color of silver you will definitely notice the amount of effort Samsung has put into designing them. The redesign of the comfort fit means that these buds will stay intact even during the most rigorous workouts or prolonged listening to of music. The design of the headphones follows the contours of the head enhancing on noise cancellation thus providing the user with toch sound without interruption.When it comes to sound, and you will be hard pressed to find a better set of true wireless earphones than the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro. The 3D audio technology involved with the earbuds puts you in an immersive and spacious sound field when you listen to music, movies or podcasts. The sound optimization which is done through AI enhances the sound to meet your specific preference as a user. The end product is clear and dynamic sound that is at par with wired headphones’ experience.This is complemented by the noise cancellation function integrated into these earphones. Just like all Samsung’s gadgets the noise cancelling feature is very much advanced and there was no interference of outside noise when I listened to my audio content. Even when all you need is to listen to your music/library, or if you have a work/business to attend to, you can exercise the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro noise cancellation feature.But more is still on store, in the lines of innovation. The real-time built-in interpreter will ensure that you don’t leave a meeting or during your foreign trip stranded for words during the meeting. It employs an AI algorithm that allows you to translate up to 16 languages from the location of your travel to avoid communication barriers.The other fact that differentiates the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro from another is the battery power of this accessory. To provide a small overall volume, these compact earbuds are equipped with efficient design and mighty battery that allows recording 29 hours of playback time. This means you can listen to any type of audio content for days without having to plug your earphones to a charger.With regards to connectivity, it’s got simple pairing and smart switching between devices in line with Bluetooth 5.3. If you have any other Samsung device, the company’s well-integrated experience guarantees that your Galaxy Buds 3 Pro will always be waiting for connection.Finally, a 2-year warranty exclusively available on Amazon also means that your beautific investment will serve shelter for potential flaws in the device.If you want to buy truly wireless earbuds, the Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Pro has that feature down pat, robust sound quality, additional bells and whistles, and ergonomic design of the earbuds. If you intend to find lose a pair of wireless earbuds that may serve your active lifestyle whilst providing the best sound quality, Galaxy Buds 3 Pro should definitely fit the bill. You won't be disappointed.

Actually worth the price. The pinch function works great, the ANC is great, the volume is spectacular, and they fit in my ear for my 6 mile run today and didn't fall out even remotely (despite that i sweat a lot). The case is compact and everything is very well built, although the case feels a bit "plastic-y". Just be cautious with that. They are pretty comfortable as well, the M size nibs fit for me. The connectivity is of course very quick and took me less than a minute to set it up right. No fooling around with EQs necessarry either- for most. They sound fantastic out the box. If you're a bit of an audiophile like me, you'll appreciate the experience for all genres. I suspect if you like a lot of hip hop/rap/pop/electronic music you may want to hike up the bass and scoop the mids a bit. And for rock/metal/country/jazz/classical these will sound great as is but i lowered the 4k a bit and boosted the 63 and 125 to give it a slight bump in bass still for personal preference. Highly recommend overall, especially if you have a Samsung as it fits well into the ecosystem. No comment on battery life as this is just 1 good day of use,  but I'm assuming it will work for my purposes and just need to charge up daily/every other day (if that? Maybe better?) which is okay either way.

I’ve used almost every iteration of the Galaxy Buds, and the Buds 3 Pro are a massive step up in terms of hardware. The soundstage is wider and the call clarity is the best I’ve experienced on a pair of stems.The Pros:The Fit: They feel more secure than the previous 'bean' or 'bud' shapes. I can wear them for hours without ear fatigue.ANC Performance: The Active Noise Canceling is top-tier. It easily drowns out low-frequency hums like plane engines or office chatter.Sound Quality: Crisp highs and a punchy bass that doesn't feel muddy.The One Con: If you like to sing along to your music, turn off the Voice Detect/Adaptive mode. The AI is so sensitive that it thinks I’m trying to start a conversation whenever I sing a lyric, and it immediately lowers the music volume. It’s a great feature for an office, but a total buzzkill for solo jam sessions.Verdict: Incredible hardware. Just be prepared to dive into the Wearable app settings to customize the AI features to your liking.

product_name: Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 Wireless Earbud Headphones - Silver

reviews.review: About 5 years ago Samsung released the legendary Galaxy Buds Live in August of 2020I was fortunate enough to be able to receive buds live with an s22 ultra from Samsung in 2021, those buds have been my daily driver's since thenWe are talking all day long from work, to the ride home and throughout my night and even through sleep on some occasionsFinding a replacement for the buds live is challenging, I was not lucky enough to grab a new pair at retail before they were discontinued and my old buds have various issues between charging to audio quality but now is the time they get replacedThe new buds 3 were a somewhat confusing decision only due to Amazon having a separate more expensive version with a two year warranty and some issue with shipping but whateverAfter my first use I am very blown away, I have only turned them up to about 1/3 the max volume but they are noticeably louder than my buds live which have to be turned up until two notches past the volume warning to hear under certain circumstancesThe fit in the ear is much better due to the larger design and the speaker hole is also bigger so the sound isn't so cannedThe price was ok about 100 but I can't speak for the battery life or anything else yetIf there was one thing I don't like it's the stem controls but in comparison to the buds live with a touch sensor on the exterior that always didn't function correctly... Even with touches blocked it would still hang up calls so I had to use good lock to make a custom event where if I double tap the power button it enabled touches blocked but I had to do this Everytime I switch earphones or if I go from a video to answering a call it would re enable touchesI paired my buds with a locking case from Spigen. Not happy that you have to glue the top on but Spigen gives you a spare adhesive strip and so far it doesn't seem like it will come apart easily

These headphones are the best I've ever used.They have great audio quality, are very easy to use, and the battery can last all night.They are also very durable; I've dropped them several times and they still work perfectly.

The Samsung Galaxy Buds 3 were described as brand new. I am very pleased with my purchase as they function perfectly due to their new condition. They connect via Bluetooth, feature noise cancellation, and are very comfortable to use. Additionally, they are easy to pair with the Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus. These Samsung buds are of high quality and operate flawlessly.

TLDR; These are great, even at MSRP. I wish I bought these when they came out. Sale prices make these a no brainer, especially for those that don't want rubber tips in their ears. Battery life is decent and all play/pause and volume swipe functions work in Windows 11 without the app installed.This will include comparisons to AirPods 4 ANC:I've been using AirPods 4 on my PC for a while and they've worked fine.  My personal gripe is that the stem doesn't have the volume swipe gestures like the AirPods Pro 2/3.  Maybe Apple will add this for AirPods 5 in the future, but guess what these have now. That's right, I can now adjust volume as well.Fitment will depend of the person, like most earbuds, but these feel just slightly larger in general so in my case, they fit fine.Sound quality seems fine.  I'm no audiophile but these sound good with a hint more bass than the Airpods but I believe this can be adjusted.Wireless charging works like it should and I've got some Ringke cases on the way to get them to latch on to magsage chargers.Note, there is software for Windows 11 already and it looks basic but it seemingly gives you a better idea of the buds battery life instead of the built in Windows bluetooth page staying at 100% until you reconnect them to reflect the actual battery life. And speaking of, battery life is good.  Granted these are brand new but they seemingly went the full 5-6 hours when switching noise cancelling on and off.I initially thought these had a transparency mode but looks like these simply don't.  So the Airpods 4 ANC get a slight edge, but I'm taking the volume control over that.  I would love for these to come out in a variety of colors, not just because options would be nice, but since I've got two pairs, the different colors would make it much more obvious which pair goes where. That's another thing the Ringke cases will help with.Well done Samsung.
Great sound quality but if you dont have average sized ears, they dont fit.. they are always falling out of my ears

I use these daily and have not been disappointed. I work construction and go to the gym. They have held up through the rain, sweat, dirt, drops off of ladders and just keep working, durable is an understatement. They connect right to my phone soon as I pull them out of the case. Volume and clarity is great. Sleek design and don't fall out of my ear.

I dont agree with the reviews on here. Especially the one saying his Airpods worked better on his Samsung than these. Not sure what went on there but it's quite the opposite with me. These work 10x better with my z fold 7 than my airpods. All my issues went away and the audio is really good on these. Loud and clear with a little bit of bass. Not much.

The sound quality is amazing and overall quality is good. They connect well to my phone and the setup was very easy. Charge time is decent. The biggest downfall for me is that they don’t stay in my ears as well as normal earbuds.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 2 Pro True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds w/ Noise Cancelling, Hi-Fi Sound, 360 Audio, Comfort Ear Fit, HD Voice, Conversation Mode, IPX7 Water Resistant, Graphite (Renewed)

reviews.review: It works great! I bought it refurbished and it definitely an upgrade from the original Buds Pro! Better noise canceling, sound and better design as well! It does work with older models such as the Samsung Galaxy S21 FE. The case fells so nice but can easily get scratched if left in pocket with car keys and other hard objects. Battery life is not bad at all, as both buds can last 2+ hours or more, even if you you use it longer and the battery dies out, it charges super quickly. The case should charge the earbuds 3 around full battery cycles, more or less. I've read reviews  about the bad comfort from the Buds 3 so I chose this one, refurbished. Good as new!

What you should know!These are the best buds I have used and also my second pair.  I don't like the stem on the buds pro3 and have read the sound isn't as good.  These buds are awesome!  I am sure if you find some in good condition you will agree.Tech KingsThis is the seller which I purchased these from.  They were clean and pound just as hard as my first pair.  They come with a short charging cord and only 2 sets of tips.  Was a little disappointed about that as my first came with 3 pair.Be smart when cleaning!I use these a lot!  That being said these buds get dirty. Be easy when cleaning them!  I ruined my first pair and had to order replacements.  I would do so again in a heartbeat as I love them.  I hope the pro buds 4 do away with the stupid stem design and go back to this compact style.

If you just want something that works with Amazon Music on your phone then this will work. It's refurbished so it's just okay and it won't compare to a brand new SGBP2. Sound quality is decent (kinda like the first edition) but for some reason,I can't adjust volume by tapping the buds which I could do with my other SGBP2 I got from Samsung Store. Also,I didn't get extra earbuds for other sizes but it's a good thing that the one that came with it was perfect fit. So yeah,we're just getting our money's worth.

Bought on 02/15/25 at about 11:55pm and it came fast...it was here by 02/16/25 between 8-10am.I'm coming from using the "Samsung Galaxy Buds+" and "Samsung Galaxy Buds2" which i have had for 5 and 4yrs+ respectively. I love to stick with things and i love comfort and i don't like the unpredictability of new things.My Samsung Buds2 tip got spoiled plus it's no longer as loud, while working out last week, the left side of my Buds+ went out. I did everything i could and even called Samsung to no avail. I have small ears and so i really loved my previous buds. I was really apprehensive towards these ones being that they don't look as compact as the last ones I own. When i got them, they did not have the original box, so i was even more apprehensive and thought to myself I will surely be returning this. BUT, upon opening it, it was clean and no visible damage or anything.So far, the sound quality blew my mind immediately i put it on, I got chills. Also, upon taking a picture of it on my S24+ to leave this review, it automatically gave me option to pair(interesting). I hadn't had it on for long before the battery ran out but i can't comment on this because i do not know if it was fully charge(update later on this).The fit is also something I'll have to get used to as my ears are small(I loved the fit of the Buds+ better). It also has some settings that are not available on the other sets i have such as-"Voice Detect"(reduces volume if it detects your voice incase you are having a conversation while listening so you don't have to take them off)-"Head tracking"(adjusts volume according to how you turn your head)-Neck Stretch reminders(incase you bend your head too much looking at your screen).Now i waiting a few days to post this review( 03/02/25). I'd have to say although i really love the sound quality, but i have to constantly adjust it in my ears alot more than i did my last two especially when i go jogging/running. Literally every few seconds. Annoying...but I don't think I'll return it because i don't have a better audio option for the price point at this time. Also, it doesn't have the volume touch controls like the previous ones.07/06/25: Update.This is a long overdue update. Now i get why it was on refurbished sale. The earbuds are horrible for calls which are very important for me. No one can here me on the phone if i use them which is pretty annoying since it was one of the most important reasons i bought them.

I had a Buds Pro I got a few years ago, and then I guess they fell out of my pocket while I was out because they're gone. So I got these.Fit feels a little better than the Pros did, but I'm probably imagining that. Connects to the wear app easily and well, allowing control such as changing from surround sound to ambient sounds. Love that you can turn off touch controls. My ears are garbage at holding buds in so I constantly have to push them back in. (It's not an incorrectly sized ear-tip. Large is way too big, medium doesn't get a perfect grip. Broken ears.)I will admit I haven't tried the call option, as I seldom get calls, and haven't at all while wearing them. I do know the original Pros worked great though. Just tested it calling someone. Both of us noticed no sound issues. They didn't know I wasn't using my phone and they sounded normal to me.I am kinda sad color-wise. The original Pros had a like, glittery-ness to them, the the buds themselves were mirror-like. These are just a plain pastel purple, which I still like but don't think is as pretty. However, I think part of that is the material on the outside of the box is more tacky. The originals were smooth, and I imagine the change was to keep them from easily falling out of your pocket. The biggest issue is, if you have the white or purple, they smudge visibly easier.I had hoped that the find your earbuds option was for if you misplaced the whole thing, but it's simply for if you drop a bud and cant find it, which is disappointing.I can't give a good estimate on battery life. I just spent the past twenty minutes in a call and  the buds went down 5% I don't use them a lot because I'm disabled so I don't go out much, and I've never looked at the battery% once I was done. I will say my box is still at 21% after using them for probably around 15-18 hours, so that's not bad at least.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds3 Pro (2024, ANC) Water Resistant, AI Real-Time Language Interpreter, True Wireless Bluetooth 5.4 Earbuds, Hi-Fi, Noise Cancelling, Touch Control, International Model R630 (Silver)

reviews.review: I bought the international version of the Samsung Galaxy Buds3 Pro mainly because of the better price. I very rarely need warranty replacement for items like this so I appreciate the lower price. I really appreciate the great noise canceling of these ear buds when working out at the gym. The bass really seems a lot better than my previous Samsung ear buds. I would really recommend these for anybody considering them.
Amazing product Long range connectivity sound great no more to say its samsung always great products

Fits my ears perfectly. The sound is amazing. The noise cancelation is great. I can have a normal conversation on the phone with them. I dont have to talk loud for the person to hear me.  Best purchase I've made.

Bought 2 pair.  I love mine, the other is a gift for my husband who still uses a wired pocket earbud.We use Samsung Smart phones, so this connectivity and compatibility was very important.So comfortable, I don't know I have them on.  The sound is and quality are incredible.  Wirth the price so far.

They're good headphones into everything they are supposed to. They are very compatible and the app is great. If you have a Samsung phone I would recommend them. I wish they were slightly louder which is why they were only getting four stars, even though they are very good quality.

These buds are a big let-down, especially since they are priced and positioned to be the top buds Samsung makes. I'm into personal tech, and I own way too many Apple and Samsung devices. I currently use a Samsung Galaxy Fold 7, and that is the phone I've been using with these buds. I also currently own the Galaxy Watch Ultra, and I also have Apple Earpods Pro as well (also used the Samsung buds with Ipad Pros and Window laptops)Unfortunately, from a reliability stand point, the Apple Earpods Pro work better with my Samsung phone than Samsung's own ear buds.Issues:1. My right ear bud just stopped charging and connecting. I've charged, pulled the bud in and out of the case, pushed it in, re-paired, reset, and I cannot get the right ear bud to charge or connect. Just period, right now, after days of messing with it, the right ear bud doesn't work. I've had these buds for like 3 months.2. Pairing doesn't always activate. Generally, to pair, you open the case and hold the pair button for a few seconds, and it's supposed to enter pairing mode. Unfortunately, with these buds, that process has not worked on several occasions. I noticed this issue seems to happen more often when the buds connect to a previously paired device, and then you try to pair to a new device. Probably a software bug, but common, these are the Pros, and should not have these issues. For comparison, I've never had a pairing issue with my Airpods Pros, Apple or Android device.3. Mic/voice dropouts. On several occasions, when answering a phone call, or doing a Teams call, the audio would work, but the mic would not. The bluetooth settings would say everything is connected (both audio and mic), but for whatever reason, the mic-audio would not work. Probably another software setting, but it happened to me on a couple important work-related calls, and it's one of those things that really makes you lose confidence in the buds. I've had this happen once with the Airpods Pros, but only once.Good things:1. As a techy person, I really liked the LED lights on the blade portion of the buds.2. When it works, big caveat, when it works, the integrated world of Samsung devices is nice (e.g. auto-switch between devices, battery levels, customization, etc).3. I like the look of the case and buds better than the Apply buds.Would I buy again? No. If you're debating between the Samsung buds Pro and the Apply buds Pro, even if you're an Android user, I would recommend going with the Apple Buds Pro.
Awesome bass. Definitely worth every penny

I have tried a handful of Bluetooth ear buds and have used airpods pro 2 as my daily drivers for the past 2yrs. These sound better and from what I can tell the mics do a better job at noise isolation. There are things that samsung really should change on the next iteration of these. The way they seat into the case could have been better, the angle they sit at I have to turn the ear buds 180 degrees to put them in my ear when pulling them from the case. The triangular shaped stems make it so you have to put them back into the case a certain angle and requires more effort from the user versus with a rounded stem you just get the stem partialy in the case and then the built in magnets helping get them orientated and seated correctly. When adjusting them in my ears, I almost every time hit the haptic button built into the stems that pauses the music. They should have put more thought into the colors. I intentionally didn't go with the white because I didn't want them to look like my previous airpods but the silver color with the blue and red tabs on the bottom makes them look pretty chintzy. At a $250 MSRP directly competing with airpods, it's very disappointing that the case doesn't have the ultra-wideband built in to be able to use the radar like feature from your phone to find them. The find my feature relies on the buds being out of the case and reliant on chirping noise from the buds to find them. I had to buy a samsung smart tag to attach to the protective case carabiner so I could have this feature. Volume is great on these, they are as loud, if not slightly louder then airpods. I find that battery life on these are excellent. With ANC on the battery is around 6hrs and way longer if you have ANC off.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds Pro R190 Bluetooth Earbuds True Wireless, Noise Cancelling (Renewed)

reviews.review: They are in perfect condition. I'm very pleased with the quality! Thank you very much.  Perfect fit excellent volume. Worked with my Samsung phone and paired instantly. Water resistant and perfectly clear

This was my 1st set of wireless earbuds the sound quality is very good for music  or for audiobooks which was my main usage. Quick set up on me Galaxy Phone. For some reason they did not fit my ears. They were comfortable to wear. I used them as much as 4 to 5 hours at a time. As soon as I started moving around they became loose and would fall out of my ear.I replaced them with over the ear model. Which works better for me. I gave the Samsung Galaxy Bud's to my daughter in-law. She loves them no problems...
I’m so happy with these Galaxy Buds! The sound quality is great, very comfortable to wear, and the battery lasts a long time without charging. Totally worth it — love them!

These renewed Galaxy Buds Pro arrived in excellent condition and function like new.  The sound quality is impressive, with effective noise cancellation and clear audio.  The Phantom Violet color is vibrant and adds a stylish touch.  However, they tend to slip out during workouts, and the battery life is decent but not exceptional.  Overall, a solid purchase for the price.

I wanted to love these Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro in Phantom Silver. Really, I did. They looked sleek, sounded crisp, and the noise canceling was so good I couldn’t hear my neighbor’s lawnmower OR his terrible karaoke. For a brief, shining moment, I thought we had a future together.Then the romance ended.Battery life: Nonexistent. These things died faster than my motivation on a Monday morning.Fit: Imagine throwing a bar of soap in your ear and hoping it stays. Spoiler: it doesn’t. I tried all three sizes of tips. My ears rejected them like an organ transplant gone wrong.Connection: The sound cut in and out like they were trying to Morse code me a distress signal. (Probably saying “return me, please.”)To be fair, when they did work, they sounded fantastic. Crisp highs, solid bass, and the noise reduction could probably drown out my mother-in-law’s “helpful suggestions.”But after two days of frustration, I’m packing them up and sending them home. Good sound, terrible everything else.Final verdict: Great for a demo. Terrible for real life. Unless you enjoy chasing earbuds across the floor like a toddler chasing Skittles.
Not bad at all for refurbished! Connected with ease and they sound awesome! Thank you!

I upgraded to these after losing my beloved Galaxy Buds+ and was mildly disappointed. After using these for three or four years, I have since moved on to the much happier pair of Galaxy Buds3.Compared to buds I've had before and after, the fit for these was the worst. They would easily slip out of my ears (regardless of which earbud-tip size I attached.) They also hurt to wear, after a while.Something about the case's shape also meant that any time I dropped it, it opened and launched the earbuds into oblivion. They were never damaged, so I guess in that sense it did its job. But it's an awkward thing when it happens, for example, on an airplane.(While we're on the subject: Side-sleepers, beware, these are not the earbuds for you. They stick out too much for that and it hurts.)Battery life is about, eh, 2 - 3 hours. If it starts to die in use, you can keep the case charged and put one bud in there and just keep alternating them.One thing I'm really impressed by is their water-resistance. My cat pushed the case and buds into his water bowl, and after setting them out to dry for a day they functioned as normal.To their credit, the sound is great. They also have intuitive and useful touch-controls, and their noise cancelling is pretty decent. But the other aspects outweighed this for me, I think.The Good:- Sound is great- Touch controls are easy and work well- Noise-canceling is decent- Fantastic water resistanceThe bad:- Short battery life- Pretty uncomfortable to wearThe Ugly:- Them
Arrived overnight as promised and works perfectly so far. Definitely a recommended grab for a deal! The sound and the fit is much better than expected due to other reviews for this model.

The headphones shown in the image are the Fhumsh Wireless Headphones. These in-ear earbuds are popular on Amazon for their value and features such as Bluetooth 5.3 or higher connectivity, a charging case with a digital LED display, and IPX7 water resistance. They utilize Bluetooth 5.3 or 5.4 technology for a stable, low-latency connection. They offer up to 6-8 hours of playback on a single charge, and the charging case provides additional charges for a total of up to 50 hours of use. They feature touch controls for managing music, calls, and the voice assistant. They provide high-fidelity (Hi-Fi) stereo sound and, in many models, environmental noise cancellation (ENC) for clear calls. They are rated IPX7, making them sweatproof and splashproof, ideal for workouts.

I am very happy with these earbuds. The sound is clear and powerful, with good bass, and the Bluetooth connection is fast and stable. They are very comfortable to wear, even for long periods of time, and the battery lasts a long time. The design is nice and easy to carry. Definitely a great value for the price. I highly recommend them.

I loved these headphones. The sound is clear and powerful, with good bass, and the Bluetooth connection is fast and stable from the first use. They are very comfortable, even after several hours, and fit well to the ear without falling off. The battery lasts a long time and the case is practical for charging them at any time. They work great for calls, music and videos. Excellent option for the price, totally recommended.

product_name: SAMSUNG Galaxy Buds 3 Pro AI True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds, Noise Cancelling, Sound Optimization, Real-Time Interpreter, Redesigned Comfort Fit Latin American Version (Silver)

reviews.review: I only received them yesterday, but after using them all day, I love them.The fit is different from any other earbuds I've used. They feel like they're going to fall out, but they never did, and I was climbing ladders, bending over, etc. The looser fit is much more comfortable. They don't make my ears sore or itchy like the Galaxy buds 2 did.The sound quality and noise cancellation were surprisingly good, considering the looser-feeling fit. I listened to music all day and made a few phone calls on top of a very windy and noisy rooftop. The sound quality is much better than that of the Galaxy Buds 2, and the ANC blocked the noise from the loud HVAC unit I was working next to.I really love that they allow you to change songs, stop/start music, and change volume just by saying it, without saying "Hey Google" or doing anything else. The voice command for volume is useless, though, because it only changes by a tiny bit, so you would have to keep saying it repeatedly. It would be better if you could say to set the volume at XX%. The swipe controls on the stem work really well, but the pitch controls take some getting used to.Battery life was pretty decent. I didn't keep track, but they worked for about 3-4 hours with music at full volume. I may buy a second pair so I can having one set charging while I use the other set

It's the best product for Samsung users!Instant connectivity, very professional noise cancellation, and I found the simultaneous translation incredible (I tested it with friends from India and China). The English translation is perfect.Regarding the anatomy, I haven't been able to remove and replace the rubber band yet, but overall, it fits my ear well.Super good battery life, fast charging, and exceptional sound quality.

I was a little worried that these might be of a lower quality because they were the south american version, but everybody was right. They're just as good as the regular american version. They are of the best quality. They feel and he listen like a pair of $700.Earbuds. The sound quality is amazing! You won't be sorry if you choose these samsung buds 3 pro.I personally think they're better than the apple or google buds. No one can tell that i'm on my buds, versus phone calls. They said I sounded extremely clear.

love these things the integration with the samsung ecosystem is great. the controls take some getting used to. I'm still not the biggest fan of them but they could be worse.  the sound quality is great.

These are nice earbuds but they are now my favorite. I think the buds+ are still the most comfortable but these have amazing sound quality. The noise cancelling is really nice too but I do feel like these fall out of my ear so much easier than the buds+ I feel like I'm constantly pressing this in to my ear and iff I smile, I can feel them come loose. That's is disappointing. The other really annoying part of these is putting the buds back into the case. It's very clunky and they don't go in smoothly. I have to fight with them a little to get them in place

I debated for a long time whether to buy the Samsung headphones, and I really don't regret them. They connect amazingly with the phone, and they have excellent sound. I just wish they would improve the microphone a little.

Great headphones at this price. Sound quality is amazing (at least for people who are not true audiophiles). My mine gripe is that the earpieces have an ok at best fit, causing them them to fall out during exercises. They also pick up wind making them less then ideal when riding bikes or running.Was worried about this product as it was cheaper than any other seller, but the product itself was in great shape and was good quality. I would never spend 200+ on these headphones, but they were a steal paying 120.

product_name: Wireless Bluetooth 5.3 Earbuds for iPhone 17 Pro Max Air 16 Pro 16e 15 Plus Pixel 10 9 8 Pro XL 9a 8a 7 Bluetooth Headphones 60H Playback LED Power Display in Ear Earphones with Microphone for Sports

These earbuds were super easy to pair to my iPhone 16e. They are pretty comfortable, especially compared to the old wired earbuds that I used back in the Dark Ages. They sit close to the ear and don't look obvious when wearing.The sound quality of the earbuds is very good, and the batteries last a few hours on a charge. For listening to music, they rate a solid 5, especially considering their price point.However, the sound quality of the mic leaves much to be desired. I've been told that I sound very muffled and "distant" when talking with them. I rarely answer my phone, and when I do callers can still hear me despite the poor sound quality. My main use is for private enjoyment of entertainment on my phone, and for this function I find these quite adequate. However, it would be nice if there was a way to disable them as my phone's mic. I did some research on disabling earbud mics and the methods I found (disabling in the device's Bluetooth settings & also in the Microphone settings) were not successful.

They were comfortable to wear. I used them as much as 4 to 5 hours at a time. As soon as I started moving around they became loose and would fall out of my ear.I replaced them with over the ear model. Which works better for me. I gave the Samsung Galaxy Bud's to my daughter in-law. She loves them no problems...
I’m so happy with these Galaxy Buds! The sound quality is great, very comfortable to wear, and the battery lasts a long time without charging. Totally worth it — love them!

These renewed Galaxy Buds Pro arrived in excellent condition and function like new.  The sound quality is impressive, with effective noise cancellation and clear audio.  The Phantom Violet color is vibrant and adds a stylish touch.  However, they tend to slip out during workouts, and the battery life is decent but not exceptional.  Overall, a solid purchase for the price.

I wanted to love these Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro in Phantom Silver. Really, I did. They looked sleek, sounded crisp, and the noise canceling was so good I couldn’t hear my neighbor’s lawnmower OR his terrible karaoke. For a brief, shining moment, I thought we had a future together.Then the romance ended.Battery life: Nonexistent. These things died faster than my motivation on a Monday morning.Fit: Imagine throwing a bar of soap in your ear and hoping it stays. Spoiler: it doesn’t. I tried all three sizes of tips. My ears rejected them like an organ transplant gone wrong.Connection: The sound cut in and out like they were trying to Morse code me a distress signal. (Probably saying “return me, please.”)To be fair, when they did work, they sounded fantastic. Crisp highs, solid bass, and the noise reduction could probably drown out my mother-in-law’s “helpful suggestions.”But after two days of frustration, I’m packing them up and sending them home. Good sound, terrible everything else.Final verdict: Great for a demo. Terrible for real life. Unless you enjoy chasing earbuds across the floor like a toddler chasing Skittles.
Not bad at all for refurbished! Connected with ease and they sound awesome! Thank you!

I upgraded to these after losing my beloved Galaxy Buds+ and was mildly disappointed. After using these for three or four years, I have since moved on to the much happier pair of Galaxy Buds3.Compared to buds I've had before and after, the fit for these was the worst. They would easily slip out of my ears (regardless of which earbud-tip size I attached.) They also hurt to wear, after a while.Something about the case's shape also meant that any time I dropped it, it opened and launched the earbuds into oblivion. They were never damaged, so I guess in that sense it did its job. But it's an awkward thing when it happens, for example, on an airplane.(While we're on the subject: Side-sleepers, beware, these are not the earbuds for you. They stick out too much for that and it hurts.)Battery life is about, eh, 2 - 3 hours. If it starts to die in use, you can keep the case charged and put one bud in there and just keep alternating them.One thing I'm really impressed by is their water-resistance. My cat pushed the case and buds into his water bowl, and after setting them out to dry for a day they functioned as normal.To their credit, the sound is great. They also have intuitive and useful touch-controls, and their noise cancelling is pretty decent. But the other aspects outweighed this for me, I think.The Good:- Sound is great- Touch controls are easy and work well- Noise-canceling is decent- Fantastic water resistanceThe bad:- Short battery life- Pretty uncomfortable to wearThe Ugly:- Them
Arrived overnight as promised and works perfectly so far. Definitely a recommended grab for a deal! The sound and the fit is much better than expected due to other reviews for this model.
